text-controls.textarea:
Music is an art form whose medium is sound. Common elements of music are pitch (which governs melody and harmony), rhythm (and its associated concepts tempo, meter, and articulation), dynamics, and the sonic qualities of timbre and texture. The word derives from Greek μουσική (mousike), "(art) of the Muses".
The creation, performance, significance, and even the definition of music vary according to culture and social context. Music ranges from strictly organized compositions (and their recreation in performance), through improvisational music to aleatoric forms. Music can be divided into genres and subgenres, although the dividing lines and relationships between music genres are often subtle, sometimes open to individual interpretation, and occasionally controversial. Within "the arts", music may be classified as a performing art, a fine art, and auditory art.
text-controls.inplace-input: Be kind whenever possible. It is always possible.
text-controls.output: Great love and great achievements involve great risk.

rich-text-controls.htmlarea:
Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky (Russian: Пётр Ильи́ч Чайко́вский, Pëtr Il'íč Čajkóvskij pronounced [ˈpʲɵtr ɪlʲˈjitɕ tɕɪjˈkofskʲɪj]; 7 May 1840 [O.S. 25 April] – 6 November 1893 [O.S. 25 October]) was a Russian composer of the Romantic era. He wrote some of the most popular concert and theatrical music in the current classical repertoire, including the ballets Swan Lake, The Sleeping Beauty and The Nutcracker, the 1812 Overture, his First Piano Concerto, seven symphonies, and the opera Eugene Onegin.

Text is available under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike License; additional terms may apply.

other-controls.browser-button-description: A browser button's look and feel is controlled by each browser individually
other-controls.link-button-description: A link button is a link which behaves like a button
other-controls.standardized-button-description: A "standardized" button's appearance is meant to be the same on every browser
